transportAdvice: Jackson Hole has a free public bus system that connects the town of Jackson with Teton Village and key resort areas, making it reasonably accessible without a car during peak seasons; however, renting a car is strongly recommended for visiting Grand Teton National Park and more remote areas, as walking between major attractions is not practical given the distances involved.

weather.description: Cold and snowy with excellent ski conditions; expect heavy snowfall and frigid overnight temperatures.
Peak ski season continues with cold temperatures and frequent snowfall; ideal for winter sports enthusiasts.
Still cold with good snow coverage, though days begin to lengthen and temperatures slowly moderate.
Spring transition brings variable weather with a mix of snow and rain; trails may still be snow-covered at higher elevations.
Mild and increasingly green, though afternoon showers are common and some mountain roads may just be opening.
Pleasant early summer weather with wildflowers blooming; occasional afternoon thunderstorms are typical.
Warm and sunny with long days; the busiest tourist month with excellent conditions for hiking and wildlife viewing.
Warm and dry with clear skies; crowds remain high and outdoor activities are at their best.
Cooler temperatures and thinning crowds make this a beautiful month with fall foliage beginning to appear.
Autumn colors peak early in the month before temperatures drop sharply; early snowfall is possible by late October.
Cold and often snowy as winter sets in; ski resorts begin opening and the valley quiets considerably.
Full winter conditions with heavy snowfall and very cold temperatures; ski season is underway and the valley is festive.
